meanings.definition: To outline or depict as a silhouette.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys silhouetting the trees against the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The artist is silhouetting the figure in black ink.
meanings.sent3: The children had fun silhouetting their shadows on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was silhouetting against the fiery sky.
meanings.sent5: The detective was silhouetting the suspect's profile for identification.

meanings.sent1: The lamp post was silhouetting the bench in the park.
meanings.sent2: The setting sun was silhouetting the mountains beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The cat was silhouetting itself on the window curtain.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were silhouetting the moon, creating a mystical scene.
meanings.sent5: The dancer was silhouetting her graceful movements on the stage.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a silhouette.
meanings.sent1: She learned the art of silhouetting in art class.
meanings.sent2: The silhouetting of the family portrait was beautifully done.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best silhouetting was fierce.
meanings.sent4: The silhouetting of the tree against the full moon was enchanting.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed various examples of silhouetting techniques.
